In yonder cave where bloated lizards crawl,</br>And slimy snails hang matted on the wall;</br>Where chilling damp in humid clusters weeps,</br>And rankling ivy o'er the arches creeps;</br>Where screaming owls and night's black ravens sit,</br>And cloister'd bats around the ruins flit;</br>Where gliding phantoms hold their mystick spell,</br>And mumbling witches chaunt their midnight yell,—</br>Immur'd forlorn amid the mould'ring cells,</br>The pallid victim of distraction dwells.</br>Each with'ring look and furious eyeball's glow</br>Mark the deep traces of consuming woe.</br>Lo!  the sunk cheek, the ghastly face, behold!</br>View the sad remnants of the fairest mould.</br>Those clotted locks that hang disorder'd round,</br>In circling curls his manly temples bound;</br>In him united once the graces shone,</br>And expectation mark'd him for her own.—</br>Soon travel, want, and cold neglect and care,</br>Penance and pain, disease and fierce despair,</br>In dread succession follow'd close behind,</br>Nor left one vestige of the former mind!</br>'Twas thus her snare alluring Beauty spread,</br>And wove her garlands round his captive head.</br>Perfumed groves her honey paths unfold,</br>With spring's fresh blossoms and with autumn's gold;</br>Love's liquid strains responsive stole along,</br>In fainting cadence breath'd the mellow song;</br>"Ah!  cruel youth," they said, or seemed to say,</br>"Unheeding thus, why pass my roseate way;</br>Why silent thus neglect my secret bow'rs</br>My cooling grottos and my fragrant flow'rs,</br>My nodding orchards and my nectar rills,</br>My crystal fountains and my fruitful hills?</br>Ah cruel youth!  restrain thy thoughtless haste,</br>Yet deign one sip from amber rills to taste;</br>Yet deign one primrose from my shade to take,</br>'Tis beauty asks, and 'tis for Beauty's sake!"—</br>Th' enchantress ceasing, wav'd her golden hair,</br>Ten thousand odours caught the yielding air.</br>As thro' the glades the soft-ton'd murmur flow'd,</br>Each floweret open'd and each blossom glow'd.—</br>The dulcet notes on spicy pinions glide,</br>Now lure the captive, and now seem to chide;</br>Now check his steps, but checking reinspire,</br>And, adding fuel, feed each latent fire.—</br>Thus currents, pented by some sudden stay,</br>Confine their waters, and impede their way;</br>But, scope regaining, rush with double force,</br>Receive fresh ardour and impel their course.—</br>O, when the slave is thoughtless led in charms,</br>In silken chains is bound in Beauty's arms;</br>Adown the hill of fond delusion led,</br>On roses sleeping and on fragrance fed;</br>Like insects sporting in the summer's ray,</br>In dreams of rapture melt the scene away:—</br>Here step by step in devious mazes tost,</br>His honour sullied and his virtue lost!</br>Crime after crime await the prostrate soul,</br>'Till one great mischief swallows up the whole!—</br>O Lyre awake!  and thrill my dying verse,</br>Portray each horror and each flight rehearse!</br>Unfold the visions of the frantick mind,</br>Ride the dark wave and mount the viewless wind!</br>Speed through the storm where angry breakers rise,</br>And arrowy tempests flame the wrathful skies.—</br>Led by thy touch, transport from glooms of night,</br>To lands of magick and to realms of light;</br>Where spring congenial crowns the verdant clime,</br>And smiles exalting in eternal prime.—</br>Oft when the fiend the maniack spirit wakes,</br>And on the slumbers of its vision breaks;</br>Aghast and wild along the desart raves,</br>The thunder threatens and the conflict braves.</br>Courts the bleak beach where howling tempests roar,</br>And foaming billows lash the sounding shore.</br>The struggling pris'ner, lost in eddying maze,</br>Now thrills in ice, now melts in liquid blaze;</br>Now mounts the air, now dives the craggy steep,</br>And flits the regions of the gloomy deep.</br>Here holds strange converse in the realms below,</br>And greets each shadow as it passes thro'.—</br>On the swift wings of transient visions led,</br>Alternate phantoms to his fancy spread;</br>Now thro' the paths of flow'ry groves he strays,</br>Each nymph attendant on his footsteps plays;</br>Nectarious streams redundant flow along,</br>And chorals chaunt him with their tender song.</br>Soft on the ear the melting warble floats,</br>The lutes responsive catch the magick notes.</br>The wondrous sounds like David's harp of old</br>Purge the black fiend and break his mystick hold.</br>Thro' fancy's eye aray'd in varied charms,</br>Luxuriant Beauty spreads her silken arms.</br>Unrival'd here, transporting graces bloom,</br>And nature op'ning breathes her fresh perfume:</br>Rich clust'ring vines mid autumn's golden bow'rs,</br>Unite their juices with the woobine flow'rs,</br>Hills, woods, and plains in joyous union ring,</br>And glow extatick in unceasing spring!</br>To pluck the sweets with longing hand he tries,</br>But ah!  each tempter from his touching flies;</br>Again he grasps to fold the luring fair,</br>Yet still he grasps a phantom of the air.</br>Thus the doom'd wretch in parching fever stood,</br>Above his neck amid the copious flood,</br>In vain desir'd the tempting stream to lave,</br>In vain implor'd the tantalizing wave;</br>Still on it roll'd and swell'd, th' enticing pool,</br>Nor gave one drop his burning tongue to cool!—</br>The maniack raving with distraction's ire,</br>His bosom heaving and his eyes on fire;</br>Grasps the frail phantoms as they glide away,</br>In shadows vanish and in gleams decay.</br>Now distant murmurs strike the list'ning ear,</br>Promiscuous blasts in fitful streams appear;</br>Commingling thunders fierce contending rise,</br>And mission'd lightings heat the wrathful skies.</br>Swift thro' the gloom, that cloaks the marly bog,</br>Dart the grim secrets of the stifling fog,</br>Black from the caverns of all-mantling night,</br>Burst the dun spectres on the startled sight.</br>The smiling mask that treach'rous Beauty wears,</br>Commanding Justice from her visage tears.</br>Conceal'd beneath Medusa's front appears,</br>His hundred heads the venom'd Hydra rears.</br>Here baleful Envy shakes her snaky hair,</br>Close stalks behind the ghastly fiend Despair.</br>With creeping flesh wild Horror shrieking stood,</br>With ragged locks uprear'd, and frozen blood.</br>Next red Revenge, with nostrils spread broad,</br>And threatning brand with fated victims gor'd,</br>Grinding his teeth, his eyeballs black with fire,</br>Startling with frenzy and convuls'd with ire.</br>Then pale Remorse, with measured step, and slow,</br>With brow of anguish and with soul of woe,</br>His heart's best blood the gnawing vultures prey,</br>And serpents hissing throng the dreary way.</br>Then tott'ring came Disease, wasted and grim,</br>With ling'ring pace and paralytic limb;</br>Meagre and lean his foetid form decay'd;</br>A haggard phantom and a goblin shade;—</br>From his foul nostrils fum'd the putrid breath,</br>Rank with contagion and surcharg'd with death;</br>Whilst from his mouth the clammy mucus roll'd,</br>Alive with vermin and with nausea foul'd.</br>Now Suicide, the biform'd hag, was seen,</br>With rusted dagger and with famish'd mein;</br>A glass she bore, which oft, with frantick glance,</br>With rolling eye and stealing look askance,</br>Its face she sought, yet still with frenzied view</br>Reverted oft and back with terrour drew.</br>Grim Slaughter furious drives her ebon car,</br>And waves her ensigns o'er the wrecks of war;</br>Whilst Carnage smiling stalks o'er mangled bones,</br>And ghastly joyous, lists the dying groans.</br>Here Rapine fell erects his scaly crest,</br>And Plunder, scowling, grins upon his breast.</br>High o'er the van Alecto's wild fire gleams,</br>Hurls her red torches and her blazing streams;</br>Outnumb'ring fiends in wild succession tear,</br>Fierce tumult shaking from their horrent hair,</br>And breathing plagues torment the smould'ring air.</br>On sulph'rous waves, the ugly Harpies ride,</br>Begirt with storms the lava billows stride</br>And whelming chaos rules the troubled tide—</br>Starting aghast the shiv'ring maniack stares,</br>Whilst round his head conflicting tumult glares.</br>His hair uprearing in disorder flies,</br>And scalding tears burst hopeless from his eyes;</br>Along the waste in furious transport raves,</br>The shout prolonging echoes thro' the caves;</br>Now sudden halts, in death-like silence stands,</br>Rooted his feet and clench'd his quiv'ring hands;</br>Now frantick laughs and with convulsive cries,</br>His piercing voice despair's wild energies,</br>Thus dares the Daemons and the host defies.</br>"Hell breathing fiends!" the feverish wretch exclaims,</br>"Discharge your tortures and consume your flames:</br>Hurl your red bolts, your hissing serpents fling,</br>Arm'd with strange horrors and the smarting sting,</br>Tear the strong pillars of the arched sky,</br>Each mountain root and burn old ocean dry;</br>Lay waste creation and let chaos come,</br>To shake her ashes and confirm her doom;</br>Myself, secure amid your blazing war,</br>Will laugh to scorn your elemental jar,</br>Behold!  the seas and rolling waves divide,</br>And ope the flood-gates of their mystick tide.</br>Conceal'd beneath I trace my guardian road,</br>Amid the chambers of the secret flood,</br>Not far beyond the shining palace stands,</br>Not seen by mortals and not made by hands,</br>Whose golden portals, dazzling far and wide,</br>Invite the pilgrim from on ev'ry side;</br>Thro' the bright paths the blissful land is seen,</br>With autumn's fruits and spring's eternal green:</br>There vital suns with genial splendours blaze,</br>And life and light spring mutual from their rays,</br>There the bright chorus tune the living lyre,</br>Wake to bold numbers and the saints inspire;</br>Myriads uncarnate with incessant praise</br>Their incense offer and their voices raise;</br>Legions innumber'd, countless seraphim,</br>Unceasing render and uniting hymn.</br>Already now methinks their strains I join,</br>Their choirs harmonick and their songs divine.</br>Flow swift, ye streams!  urge on your wat'ry way;</br>Ye currents speed!  revive your dull delay,</br>I plunge my passage to immortal day."—</br>Then headlong leaping from the rugged steep,</br>The waves receive him in their silent deep!—</br>As by the floods the sportive Sea-Nymphs glide,</br>And gently floating skim the trembling tide,</br>Their sounding shells in varying numbers flow,</br>Now weep in anguish, now in madness glow,</br>Now hollow sounds in doles of deep despair,</br>Despondent mingling steals upon the air,</br>The sighs, slow dying in a tender tone,</br>In murm'ring accents sink a fainting moan,</br>Lull'd in deep sleep the drooping chords decay,</br>In soft vibration melting, die away!</br>Now sudden bursting from the lifeless lyre,</br>The nerve of rapture and the soul of fire,</br>Rocks, shores and woods with loud succession ring,</br>And transport leaping starts from ev'ry string.</br>Thus the wild minstrels of the mystick shell,</br>Wake the sad numbers of their fountain-knell;</br>And should the whirlwinds o'er the waters sweep,</br>Their rage command, and make the furies sleep,</br>The surges check, and bid the torrents roar</br>And break their billows on a distant shore.</br>For here the Zephyrs and the streams repose,</br>Here thoughtful silence broods her pensive woes,</br>The willows here their languid branches bend,</br>And round the brink their emblem shades extend;—</br>Here o'er pale Grief the dismal cypress spreads</br>Her sombre brows, and night-contagion spreads,</br>Here Sorrow ling'ring marks the eve-star beam,</br>The glow-worm twinkle and the silv'ry stream:</br>Here dew-drench'd garlands weeping Naiades lave,</br>Their tributes bathing in each refluent wave,</br>That, lightly passing, skim the wat'ry grave.</br>
